context: There has been a sequence of alerts indicating potential human-operated malicious activity which might lead to ransomware or other payloads being installed on target devices. Some of the notable processes executed include `powershell.exe` to disable real-time monitoring, `psexesvc.exe`, and `rubeus.exe` used to extract service tickets. These actions were observed on host `vnevado-win10b` and involved accounts such as `kyleg` (AadUserId: 97e6a954-b6bd-48a5-808c-bd8464cce677) and `fk8mq` (Sid: S-1-5-21-1540151660-3530000288-105586595-1517). One particular instance included the extraction of credentials using the Rubeus tool, which was later executed via command line by the user `lucasb`.
question: Which suspicious service was started using the `net.exe` command?
solution_steps: A suspicious service was launched with command line `net.exe start ntds` at `2024-06-27t14:34:44.6620407z`, with Process ID `3400`.
Multiple dual-purpose tools, such as `powershell.exe`, were dropped on the device.
Potential human-operated malicious activity was detected involving the execution of `rubeus.exe`.
